alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Berks and central Lehigh Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 716 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ancient Oaks, or 9 miles southwest of Allentown, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Emmaus, Topton, Ancient Oaks, Coffeetown, Macungie, Alburtis and Fullerton. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 50 and 61. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 47 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
